questions.text: A 23y primigravida presents to the labor room at 38 weeks with labor pains. On examination, she is 9 cm dilated with the vertex at -3 station. An artificial rupture of membranes is done and immediately there is acute fetal distress. The umbilical cord is lying outside the introitus. Which of the following should NOT be done?

options.label: A
options.text: Immediately replace the cord back in the uterus

questions.correct_answer: A. Immediately replace the cord back in the uterus
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Immediately replace the cord back in the uterus

questions.text: A 27y P1L1 woman presents with complaints of irregular cycles since 3 months. She says she is bleeding in between her usual cycles which is sometimes excessive. She also has mild lower abdominal pain. She earlier had regular 28 day cycles. What is the next best step?
By doing McRoberts's manuever, what are you trying to resolve?
What is the appropriate management of vulvovaginal hematomas?

options.label: B
options.text: Ultrasound guided drainage in deep hematomas is the preferred management

options.label: C
options.text: If pain is severe then ice packs and analgesia are appropriate

options.label: D
options.text: The aim of surgical management is obliteration of dead space in the hematoma

questions.correct_answer: D. The aim of surgical management is obliteration of dead space in the hematoma
questions.explanation: Ans. D) The aim of surgical  management is obliteration of dead space in the hematoma

questions.text: A 23y primi has massive atonic PPH which is uncontrolled by medical management following delivery. She is taken up for surgery and the vessel shown below was ligated. Identify the vessel. pressure in the uterine artery?
A 24y P2 is having atonic PPH following delivery. The following is used in the management. How does this instrument act?

options.label: A
options.text: By suctioning out he collected blood

options.label: B
options.text: By effective suctioning so that the uterus contracts over the catheter.

options.label: C
options.text: By intra-uterine tamponade once the bulb is inflated with saline

questions.correct_answer: C. By intra-uterine tamponade once the bulb is inflated with saline
questions.explanation: Ans. C) By intra-uterine tamponade once the bulb is inflated with saline

questions.text: A 34-year-old P2 who is a known asthmatic begins having brisk bright red bleeding following completion of a vaginal delivery. Which of the following should not be given?
The urine Congo red test has a high predictability in the identification of?

A 27-year-old multigravida tells you at her 28-week antenatal atal care visit that she shows interest in a tubal ligation after delivery. For which of the following reasons do encourage her to get the procedure done?

options.label: A
options.text: It is associated with a later age of menopause

options.label: B
options.text: It is associated with a lower incidence of ovarian cancer

options.label: C
options.text: It is associated with a lower incidence of PID

options.label: D
options.text: It is associated with a lower incidence of PCOS

questions.correct_answer: B. It is associated with a lower incidence of ovarian cancer
questions.explanation: Ans. B) It is associated with a lower incidence of ovarian cancer

questions.text: A 25y G2A1 presents with amenorrhea and nausea and vomiting for the last month. You perform a urine pregnancy test, and it is positive. You perform an ultrasound and discover the finding below at the right adnexa. It measures 2.5 cm and the beta hCG is 4530.The uterine cavity is empty. What is the next best management option?
Identify the procedure shown

Ms. M is a 28year-old recently engaged woman who wants to discuss contraceptive methods in advance of her wedding. She and her fiancé have decided to wait at least 3 years before planning a child. She has no medical comorbidities and has a normal body mass index. She has always had irregular menstrual cycles ranging from 35 to 45 days. She also has a religious objection to any method that has prevention of implantation of a fertilized embryo as a major mechanism of action. Taking all these factors into account, what is the most efficacious method you can recommend for this patient?

Ms. T visits the OPD for a routine check. She has a Copper containing IUD inserted 6 months back and is concerned as she cannot feel the thread. Her LMP was 2 weeks back. On speculum examination you see the picture below. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step?

options.label: C
options.text: Attempt IUD removal by means of an IUD hook or long artery forceps

options.label: D
options.text: Continue the exam by twirling a cytologic brush in her endocervical canal

questions.correct_answer: A. Obtain a trans vaginal ultrasound
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Obtain a trans vaginal ultrasound

questions.text: A 29-year-old G1P1 complains of worsening vulvar pain in the recovery room 6 hours following a vaginal delivery. The delivery was complicated by a prolonged second stage requiring a forceps delivery. On further evaluation, her heart rate 126 beats per minute, blood pressure 96/52 mmHg and she appears pale. Examination of the perineum reveals the findings shown in the pic below. What is the next best course of action?

options.label: B
options.text: Place a vaginal pack and observe

options.label: C
options.text: Check a complete blood count and transfuse blood if the Hb is < 8 g

options.label: D
options.text: Start intravenous antibiotics with gram-negative coverage

questions.text: A 41-year-old G4P3 presents for fetal sonographic evaluation at 19 weeks’ gestation. The following image is obtained. What is the diagnosis?

You are managing a G2P1 at 38 weeks who is attempting a trial of labor after cesarean delivery. She is 4 cm dilated, 80% effaced, and the head is at –1 station. The patients vitals were stable and she was ambulatory. 2 hours later, you notice the heart rate tracing abnormalities as shown. You do a PV but can no longer feel the fetal head. The maternal heart rate is 120 beats per minute, blood pressure is 90/46 mmHg, and RR18 breaths per minute. What is the best intervention based on the findings?
To resolve the complication shown in the image below while performing an assisted breech delivery, which of the following maneuvers should be employed?

options.label: A
options.text: The fetus should be pulled downward to release the arm

options.label: B
options.text: The fetus should be rotated 180 degrees clockwise and then counter-clockwise

options.label: C
options.text: The fetus is gently pushed upward back into the pelvis for second attempt at rotation if a primary maneuver is unsuccessful

questions.correct_answer: B. The fetus should be rotated 180 degrees clockwise and then counter-clockwise
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The fetus should be rotated 180 degrees clockwise and then counter-clockwise

questions.text: Based on the ultrasound findings shown in the image of a pregnant woman, you suspect the genetic studies to show?

options.label: D
options.text: Any of the above could be seen

questions.text: An anxious mother brings her 16y daughter to the gyn OPD. She is very concerned that she hasn’t yet got her period. On further questioning, she is active in her class and is in the school basketball team. On examination, her breasts are well developed as is her pubic and axillary hair. The external genitalia appear normal. She does not permit a vaginal exam. What is the next best step?
A 23y presents to the OPD with a concern that she is having a disturbance in the frequency of her menstrual cycles. A frequent menstrual cycle means that the cycle is shorter than

The patient pictured below presents complaining of the need to manually reduce the bulge by pushing her fingers inside the vagina every time she has to urinate so that she is able to completely evacuate the bladder. Which is the procedure used to correct this defect?

A 42-year-old multipara presents for cervical cancer screening. She is found to have a positive human papillomavirus (HPV) DNA test results. She is a long-time cigarette smoker and has had 5 lifetime sexual partners. She has not had a new sexual partner for 10 years. What is her strongest risk factor for cervical cancer?
A 23y is undergoing a TVS in view of infertility. Which is the possible cause of her infertility based on the image seen?
Which of the following is the gold standard technique for tubal evaluation?
What is the lifespan of this newly introduced contraceptive advice?

A 32-year-old patient has no complaints when presenting for a routine health maintenance visit but is found to have a clinically abnormal vaginal discharge during speculum examination of the vagina. A saline preparation of vaginal secretions demonstrates the motile pathogens shown here and marked by arrows. Which of the following is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Treatment is with metronidazole and both patient and her partner should be treated.

options.label: B
options.text: Treatment is with metronidazole and treat the partner only if symptomatic

options.label: C
options.text: Treatment is with Azithromycin and both patient and her partner should be treated

options.label: D
options.text: Treatment is with Azithromycin and treat the partner only if symptomatic

questions.correct_answer: A. Treatment is with metronidazole and both patient and her partner should be treated.
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Treatment is with metronidazole and both patient and her partner should be treated.

questions.text: A 46y woman presents with a vaginal prolapse since a year and this has worsened since a few months. The gynecologist has made a grid which has the following mentioned. What do the “+” and “-” sign in the grid denote?

options.label: A
options.text: “+” denotes the prolapse is proximal to the hymen while “-” denotes the point is distal to the hymen

options.label: B
options.text: “+” denotes the prolapse is distal to the hymen while “-” denotes the point is proximal to the hymen

options.label: C
options.text: “+” denotes the prolapse is proximal to the introital opening while “-” denotes the point is distal to the introital opening

options.label: D
options.text: “+” denotes the prolapse is distal to the introital opening while “-” denotes the point is proximal to the introital opening

questions.correct_answer: B. “+” denotes the prolapse is distal to the hymen while “-” denotes the point is proximal to the hymen
questions.explanation: Ans. B) “+” denotes the prolapse is distal to the hymen while “-” denotes the point is proximal to the hymen

questions.text: Match the deformity with the corrective surgery needed

A 35y old woman presents to the antenatal OPD. She is a primigravida and this is her 1 st visit. She is currently 12 weeks. She has occasional nausea but is otherwise well. On examination her BP is 142/96 mmHg, and repeat measurement is 138/90mmHg. A urine dipstick is negative for proteins, She is asked to return after a week for BP measurement and her BP is 150/90 mmHg. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 23y primigravida presents to the gyn OPD. She is 10 weeks pregnant. She has no nausea or vomiting and is comfortable. A TVS shows the following image. What is the probable diagnosis?
Which is incorrect regarding AMH?

options.label: A
options.text: Anti-Müllerian Hormone (AMH) is critical for physiologic involution of the Mullerian ducts during sexual differentiation in the male fetus

options.label: B
options.text: In women, AMH is a product of the small antral follicles in the ovaries and serves to function as an autocrine and paracrine regulator of follicular maturation

options.label: C
options.text: AMH is clinically useful as a screening tool for diminished ovarian reserve

options.label: D
options.text: A low AMH is good predictor of development of ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome

questions.correct_answer: D. A low AMH is good predictor of development of ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome
questions.explanation: Ans. D) A low AMH is good predictor of development of ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome

questions.text: 34 weeks G2P1L1 pregnant lady complains of bleeding PV and abdominal pain since 4 hours. Hb 6gm%, PR is 120/ min, BP-80/60mmHg, P/A- FHS absent & uterus tonically contracted. A PV reveals the cervix is 2 cm dilated, 70% effaced and Vx at -2. She appears distressed. What is the best management option?
A 55-year-old postmenopausal woman presents with vaginal bleeding of 2 days. A TVS shows there is 8 mm thickness of endometrium. Next best step of management is:
A 28-year-old primigravida with 33 weeks of pregnancy suddenly complains of headache, oliguria, and blurred vision. Her BP is 180/110 mmHg and urine albumin is +3. The next best step is:
In stage III B cervical cancer:

options.label: A
options.text: Carcinoma is confined to the cervix

options.label: B
options.text: The carcinoma extends to the upper vagina or parametrium but not to the pelvic wall

options.label: C
options.text: The carcinoma has extended to the entire vagina

options.label: D
options.text: The carcinoma has extended to the pelvic side wall

questions.correct_answer: D. The carcinoma has extended to the pelvic side wall
questions.explanation: Ans. D) The carcinoma has extended to the pelvic side wall

questions.text: What is the indication for doing this procedure?
What is this graph a part of?
A 26y woman who is undergoing evaluation for infertility presents with this HSG film, done on day 8 of her periods. What is the next best step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: Repeat HSG after a course of antibiotics.

questions.text: 24y primi is in labor. During 2nd stage, fetal distress is seen. All the following are pre-requisites for this except?

options.label: A
options.text: The fetal scalp is seen at the perineum without separating the labia

options.label: B
options.text: The cervix is at least 9 cm dilated

options.label: C
options.text: The fetal skull has reached the pelvic floor

options.label: D
options.text: The occiput lies under the pubic symphysis

questions.correct_answer: B. The cervix is at least 9 cm dilated
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The cervix is at least 9 cm dilated

questions.text: The instrument shown below is placed at the flexion point on the fetal scalp. Where is this point located?
questions.correct_answer: A. Anterior to the posterior fontanelle
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Anterior to the posterior fontanelle

questions.text: Which of the following not a component of the Bishop scor
The order a Pap smear is taken Insert vaginal wall retractor Fix the slide Scrape the ectocervix Prepare the smear
An episiotomy is being sutured as shown. What layer is being sutured in the image seen?
Following delivery of a 24y G2, you note the following. What complication was this patient at risk of if detected antenatally?
A 27-year-old woman approaches the clinic for HPV testing for cervical cancer screening. The HPV is positive for type 18 HPV. What is the next best step?

options.label: B
options.text: Acyclovir and review after 6 weeks for a repeat test

questions.text: A 30y primi undergoes a test which involves drinking of glucose followed 2 hours later by a blood test. The DIPSI cut off value to diagnosed gestational diabetes mellitus in her is taken as
34-year-old patient is undergoing laparoscopy for infertility. This image is noted. What is the likely diagnosis?
What can you infer from the following laparoscopic image done for a patient with infertility?

options.label: C
options.text: There is evidence of tubercular salpingitis

questions.correct_answer: B. The fallopian tubes are patent
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The fallopian tubes are patent

questions.text: Identify the plane in red
A woman at 32 weeks of gestation was found to have fundal height corresponding to 36 weeks. Which is not a possibility?
A 36y woman presents with inter menstrual bleeding. Cervical exam reveals this. Which instrument will you use in this patient?

Choose the order in which the following steps of total abdominal hysterectomy are done: Clamp, cut & ligate infundibulopelvic ligament Clamp, cut and ligate uterine vessels Clamp, cut and ligate round ligament Open uterovesical fold of peritoneum
A 25-year-old G2A1 presents to the Antenatal OPD at 9 weeks. List the investigations that will be done:

options.label: A
options.text: a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h

options.label: B
options.text: a, b, c, d, e, g, h

options.label: D
options.text: a, b, c, e, g, h

questions.correct_answer: D. a, b, c, e, g, h
questions.explanation: Ans. D) a, b, c, e, g, h

questions.text: The adjacent diagram shows different types of fibroid. Match the labels with the correct type of fibroid
A woman with the following obstetric performance attends the OPD at 32 weeks pregnancy in Oct 2024.
You are watching a laparoscopic hysterectomy being done. Identify the structure shown.
The dimension that is assessed at clinical pelvimetry is:
Choose the most appropriate option after correctly matching the following:

A 45-year-old woman presents to the OPD with menorrhagia and severe dysmenorrhea. She is pale and abdominal examination reveals a firm mass as shown in the diagram. On bimanual examination, the cervix moves on moving the abdominal mass. What is the likely diagnosis?
The anti- hypertensive agent contra indicated in pregnancy is?
Which is the first event in pubertal development?
The feature that is NOT present in complete testicular feminization (complete androgen insensitivity) is
What is the mean doubling time for β HCG levels in early pregnancy?
In the image below, which line corresponds to preparing the endometrial lining for a pregnancy if fertilization happens?

In the postmenopausal woman with uterine bleeding, evaluation of the endometrium may be accomplished by endometrial biopsy, hysteroscopy, or transvaginal sonography. Which of the following sonographic endometrial thickness measurements is commonly used as a threshold to indicate a low risk for endometrial hyperplasia or cancer?
A 24-year-old primigravida presents at 14 weeks pregnancy. She is worried as her combined screening test is positive. What is the next best step in management?
A 25-year-old primigravida presents to the OPD with a history of a dog bite. Her neighbor’s pet dog has bit her on the leg. She is currently 10 weeks pregnant. What is the next best step?

options.label: A
options.text: Clean the wound, administer tetanus and rabies vaccine

options.label: B
options.text: Clean the wound, administer only tetanus vaccine

questions.correct_answer: A. Clean the wound, administer tetanus and rabies vaccine
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Clean the wound, administer tetanus and rabies vaccine

questions.text: Identify the position.
A fetus diagnosed with neural tube defect at 22 weeks. The parents want an MTP. What opinions are required?

A 36y woman presents to the gyn OPD with secondary amenorrhoea. She has 1 child who is 8 years old, and she had a surgical termination of pregnancy done a year earlier. She says her mother attained menopause in her late thirties. Examination reveals a normal sized uterus, and no adnexal mass is palpable. Her pregnancy test is negative and her FSH is 6. What is the likely diagnosis?
A 24-year-old is referred for colposcopy from the primary health center in view of a suspicious looking cervix for which the midwife has sent you the image shown below. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 35y woman presents to the emergency with severe dysmenorrhoea not responding to NSAIDs. She gives a history of worsening dysmenorrhoea and also has pain when passing stools. She does not give a history of constipation. Her periods are otherwise regular. On bimanual examination, the uterus is fixed and retroverted. On further history, she reveals that she hasn’t conceived despite being married for 3 years for which she was planning to show the gynecologist. What is the probable diagnosis?

A 21y unmarried girl presents to the OPD with increasing weight gain and acne. She also complains of delayed periods which are between 45-50 days. On examination, her BMI is 28. An ultrasound reveals the following in 1 ovary. What is the best treatment option?

options.label: A
options.text: Lifestyle measures to optimize her BMI

questions.correct_answer: A. Lifestyle measures to optimize her BMI
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Lifestyle measures to optimize her BMI

questions.text: A 30y primi presents at 32 weeks for a routine checkup. On examination, the uterus is 28 weeks. The fetal parts are not easily palpable with the uterus appearing to grip the fetus, and the fetal heart rate is heard very clearly. An ultrasound is ordered. Which of the following will you expect to find on the ultrasound?
Identify what procedure is being planned here?

A 32y woman presents at 14 weeks pregnancy. She has a history of 2 mid trimester abortions. Pre conceptionally she was told that she may need a cervical cerclage to be done. An ultrasound shows the cervix to be 2.3 cm in length. What is the next best step?

options.label: D
options.text: Strict bed rest and repeat a scan after 2 weeks

questions.text: A 34-year-old P2L2 is taking “Chhaya” for contraception. She has been taking it for 9 months. She reports to you that she has missed taking the pill for the last 2 weeks as she had been traveling and forgot to carry the pill with her. How many tablets has she missed?
A 65y woman presents with epithelial ovarian cancer with peritoneal metastases and ascites. What is the management?

A 23y woman presents to the antenatal OPD. She is 12 weeks pregnant. Her Gestosis score is found to be 4 and she is told she is high risk of developing preeclampsia. Which of the following medical therapies has been associated with a modest decrease in the incidence of early onset pre-eclampsia in women at increased risk?

options.label: C
options.text: Both aspirin and Low molecular weight heparin

questions.text: A 34y P1 has starting using the combined oral contraceptive pill for family planning. Since she is new to the method, she skipped 2 pills in the 3 rd week of the pack and approaches the OPD and asks if there is a possibility of pregnancy. What is your advice?

options.label: A
options.text: Take the last missed pill as soon as possible and continue the remaining packet

options.label: B
options.text: Take the last 2 missed pills as soon as possible, use an additional method for 7 days and take the emergency contraceptive pill

options.label: C
options.text: Take the last missed pill as soon as possible, use an additional method for 7 days and take the emergency contraceptive pill

options.label: D
options.text: Take the last missed pill as soon as possible, use an additional method for 7 days, take the emergency contraceptive pill and skip the pill free interval

questions.correct_answer: A. Take the last missed pill as soon as possible and continue the remaining packet
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Take the last missed pill as soon as possible and continue the remaining packet

questions.text: A 32-year-old primigravida at 37+2 weeks gestation presents for a routine antenatal visit. A bedside ultrasound confirms a breech presentation, and she has an otherwise uncomplicated pregnancy. She expresses a strong preference for vaginal delivery and asks about her options. Her amniotic fluid index (AFI) is 12 cm, and there is no history of prior uterine surgery. What is the next best step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: Schedule an elective cesarean section at 39 weeks.

options.label: C
options.text: Advise waiting until spontaneous labor begins before making a decision.

options.label: D
options.text: Perform an immediate induction of labor and attempt vaginal breech delivery.

questions.correct_answer: B. Offer an external cephalic version (ECV).
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Offer an external cephalic version (ECV).
